const placeholder = `# Welcome to my React Markdown Previewer! ## This is a sub-heading... ### And here's some other cool stuff: Heres some code, \`
\`, between 2 backticks. \`\`\` // this is multi-line code: function anotherExample(firstLine, lastLine) { if (firstLine == '\`\`\`' && lastLine == '\`\`\`') { return multiLineCode; } } \`\`\` You can also make text **bold**... whoa! Or _italic_. Or... wait for it... **_both!_** And feel free to go crazy ~~crossing stuff out~~. And if you want to get really crazy, even tables: Wild Header | Crazy Header | Another Header? ------------ | ------------- | ------------- Your content can | be here, and it | can be here.... And here. | Okay. | I think we get it. - And of course there are lists. - Some are bulleted. - With different indentation levels. - That look like this. `; export default placeholder;

sourcesContent:
const placeholder = `# Welcome to my React Markdown Previewer! ## This is a sub-heading... ### And here's some other cool stuff: Heres some code, \`
\`, between 2 backticks. \`\`\` // this is multi-line code: function anotherExample(firstLine, lastLine) { if (firstLine == '\`\`\`' && lastLine == '\`\`\`') { return multiLineCode; } } \`\`\` You can also make text **bold**... whoa! Or _italic_. Or... wait for it... **_both!_** And feel free to go crazy ~~crossing stuff out~~. And if you want to get really crazy, even tables: Wild Header | Crazy Header | Another Header? ------------ | ------------- | ------------- Your content can | be here, and it | can be here.... And here. | Okay. | I think we get it. - And of course there are lists. - Some are bulleted. - With different indentation levels. - That look like this. `; export default placeholder;
